Title.evidence: Neural Mechanisms of Pain-Depression Comorbidity in Postherpetic Neuralgia: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at the Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine.

Participants.evidence: Participants included 17 depressed PHN patients, 19 non-depressed PHN patients, and 34 healthy controls (HCs). Eligibility criteria included right-handedness and a diagnosis of PHN.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to identify characteristic brain signals associated with pain-depression comorbidity in PHN patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in fALFF values in the right temporal lobe (TL) and its connectivity with the inferior frontal gyrus (IFG) over a 5-minute scan period.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants included 17 depressed PHN patients, 19 non-depressed PHN patients, and 34 healthy controls (HCs).

Result_Outcome.evidence: One-way analysis of covariance revealed significant differences in fALFF values in the right TL and its connectivity with the IFG among the three groups.
